intro: Canthium thunbergianum, commonly known as the African eggplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by indehiscent, capsule-like fruits. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Rubiaceae family, often found in woodland and savanna habitats. The plant is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
